oai_dc:dc.dc:description: How an old woman asked a Chameleon for rain, and knew, from its way of looking, that rain would fall; as it indeed did that very night. In the Katkop dialect, by ≠kásin, who heard it from his mother (L IV.
3737). The family smells the rain coming and find rain
plants which the old woman throws on the ground to make moisture and the two children find and cook a great tortoise and eat it.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: How an old woman asked a chameleon for rain
